title: Former Strictly professional Brendan Cole throws thinly veiled dig at BBC dancing show
text:

Former Strictly Come Dancing professional Brendan Cole has thrown a thinly veiled dig at the hit dancing show as he gushed about his latest venture The X Factor : Celebrity.

The performer, 43, who has ditched his dancing shoes in favour of picking up the microphone on the latest X Factor spin-off, has hailed the singing contest as an "incredible show" which will be "the biggest" TV series.

Speaking to The Mirror at the press launch, the New Zealand native, 43, was very complimentary of Simon Cowell's talent contest and accepting the offer to appear.

He told: "Opportunities come up and there’s a lot of things you go, ‘should I do it, should I not’ and to this I said absolutely, why not. This is an incredible show to be a part of. It’s one of the biggest shows on TV, and hopefully the biggest after this.”

The singing hopeful also shared his thoughts on not being on the Strictly line-up anymore.

(Image: PA Archive/PA Images)

Brendan reflected: "Being on Strictly is a great show. I’m so honoured to have been a part of it for 15 years but I’m no longer a part of it, that chapter is parked. This is a new chapter for me, and it’s ridiculously exciting for all of us.”

He also added that Strictly have some down sides as he shared: "The time during Strictly you can’t do anything else because it doesn’t allow for it, it’s five months of the year."

Brendan will not be rocking the mic solo on the celebrity edition of X Factor as he is partnering up with his pal actor Jeremy Edwards.

(Image: Dymond/Thames/Syco)

The former Holby City actor and dancer are looking to impress judges Simon Cowell , Louis Walsh and Nicole Scherzinger and scoop a record deal.

Cole's move from the BBC to rival ITV may have riled his former bosses after they axed him from Strictly last year for clashing with the show's producers one too many times.

A source close told The Sun : "Initially it started out as a bit of a novelty idea but they're really enjoying it and have started to feel pretty optimistic about making a mark on the show."

(Image: DAVID VENNI)

It's a bold move from Brendan who has never been one to shy away from controversy.

The source added: "They've already filmed their first scenes, so there's no going back - but Strictly probably won't be too impressed when they find out he has jumped on board with their biggest rival after al those years."

(Image: Evening Gazette)

They will competed with other bands including a Love Island supergroup and a team of singing rugby hunks.

Brendan and Jeremy, 48, are both long-standing stars in their own field, with Cole having served on Strictly for 15 series making him one of the most popular professionals.

Edwards starred in Hollyoaks for four years followed by another four at Holby City.
